cve.summary: The prompt parsing in bash allows a local user to execute commands as another user by creating a directory with the name of the command to execute.

1   bash before 1.14.7, and  2   tcsh 6.05 allow local users to gain privileges via directory names that contain shell metacharacters  ` back-tick  , which can cause the commands enclosed in the directory name to be executed when the shell expands filenames using the     option in the PS1 variable.
The prompt parsing in bash allows a local user to execute commands as another user by creating a directory with the name of the command to execute.
